item.title: Robert add a quote by Stéphane Mallarme
item.description: "The flesh is sad, alas, and I have read all the books." -- Stéphane Mallarme

item.title: Robert add a quote by Chuck Palahniuk
item.description: "It's so hard to forget pain, but it's even harder to remember sweetness. We have no scar to show for happiness. We learn so little from peace." -- Chuck Palahniuk

item.title: Robert add a quote by Giuseppe Tomasi di Lampedusa
item.description: "Love. Of course, love. Flames for a year, ashes for thirty." -- Giuseppe Tomasi di Lampedusa

item.title: Robert add a quote by Giuseppe Tomasi di Lampedusa
item.description: "If we want things to stay as they are, things will have to change." -- Giuseppe Tomasi di Lampedusa

item.title: Robert add a quote by Giuseppe di Lampedusa
item.description: "All this shouldn't last; but it will, always; the human 'always' of course, a century, two centuries... and after that it will be different, but worse. We were the Leopards, the Lions; those who'll take our place will be little jackals, hyenas; and the whole lot of us, Leopards, jackals, and sheep, we'll all go on thinking ourselves the salt of the earth." -- Giuseppe di Lampedusa

item.title: Robert add a quote by Richard Avedon
item.description: "A portrait is not a likeness. The moment an emotion or fact is transformed into a photograph it is no longer a fact but an opinion. There is no such thing as inaccuracy in a photograph. All photographs are accurate. None of them is the truth. " -- Richard Avedon

item.title: Robert add a quote by Franz Kafka
item.description: "A book must be the axe for the frozen sea within us." -- Franz Kafka

item.title: Robert add a quote by Emily Dickinson
item.description: "I dwell in possibility…" -- Emily Dickinson

item.title: Robert add a quote by Henry James
item.description: "Don't pass it by--the immediate, the real, the only, the yours." -- Henry James

item.title: Robert add a quote by George Gordon Byron
item.description: "There is a pleasure in the pathless woods, There is a rapture on the lonely shore, There is society, where none intrudes, By the deep sea, and music in its roar: I love not man the less, but Nature more" -- George Gordon Byron

item.title: Robert add a quote by Sylvia Plath
item.description: "Kiss me, and you will see how important I am." -- Sylvia Plath

item.title: Robert add a quote by Sylvia Plath
item.description: "I can never read all the books I want; I can never be all the people I want and live all the lives I want. I can never train myself in all the skills I want. And why do I want? I want to live and feel all the shades, tones and variations of mental and physical experience possible in life. And I am horribly limited." -- Sylvia Plath

item.title: Robert add a quote by Nelson Algren
item.description: "Never play cards with a man called Doc. Never eat at a place called Mom's. Never sleep with a woman whose troubles are worse than your own." -- Nelson Algren

item.title: Robert add a quote by Nelson Algren
item.description: "Any writer who knows what he's doing isn't doing very much." -- Nelson Algren

item.title: Robert add a quote by Nelson Algren
item.description: "Yet once you've come to be part of this particular patch, you'll never love another. Like loving a woman with a broken nose, you may well find lovelier lovelies. But never a lovely so real." -- Nelson Algren

item.title: Robert add a quote by Milan Kundera
item.description: "The bloody massacre in Bangladesh quickly covered over the memory of the Russian invasion of Czechoslovakia, the assassination of Allende drowned out the groans of Bangladesh, the war in the Sinai Desert made people forget Allende, the Cambodian massacre made people forget Sinai, and so on and so forth until ultimately everyone lets everything be forgotten." -- Milan Kundera

item.title: Robert add a quote by Charles Dickens
item.description: "You may be an undigested bit of beef, a blot of mustard, a crumb of cheese, a fragment of underdone potato. There's more of gravy than of grave about you, whatever you are!" -- Charles Dickens

item.title: Robert add a quote by Gabriel García Márquez
item.description: "There's no greater misfortune than dying alone." -- Gabriel García Márquez

item.title: Robert add a quote by Gabriel García Márquez
item.description: "...the invincible power that has moved the world is unrequited, not happy love" -- Gabriel García Márquez

item.title: Robert add a quote by Gabriel García Márquez
item.description: "The truth is I'm getting old, I said. We already are old, she said with a sigh. What happens is that you don't feel it on the inside, but from the outside everybody can see it." -- Gabriel García Márquez

item.title: Robert add a quote by Stendhal
item.description: "One can acquire everything in solitude except character." -- Stendhal
